title: Statistics Teaching Material
text:
Welcome
On this website you can find animated and interactive teaching materials for statistics and econometrics courses

A repository containing teaching materials for econometrics (OLS sampling distribution, heteroskedasticity, LLN, CLT, confidence intervals): LINK
A shiny app example with California STR data: LINK
The Econometrics with R open book by Christoph Hanck et al. contains an interactive html script to study the OLS estimator: LINK. The exercise sections contain interactive R problems using the datacamp widget: LINK
Another datacamp exercise website: LINK. source.

title: 2  Datacamp Examples
text:
Experimental page for Datacamp tasks Click Me! # This will get executed each time the exercise gets initialized b = 6 # Create a variable a, equal to 5 # Print out a # Create a variable a, equal to 5 a <- 5 # Print out a print(a) test_object("a") test_function("print") success_msg("Great job!")
Use the assignment operator (<-) to create the variable a.
# no pec # Calculate 3 + 4 3 + 4 # Calculate 6 + 12 # Calculate 3 + 4 3 + 4 # Calculate 6 + 12 6 + 12 test_output_contains("18", incorrect_msg = "Make sure to add 6 + 12 on a new line. Do not start the line with a #, otherwise your R code is not executed!") success_msg("Awesome! See how the console shows the result of the R code you submitted?
